title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: The game has serious lag right after start for a few minutes but that goes mostly away after a while. In certain areas the FPS tanks down to sub 30fps. The Steam FPS counter appears to be broken, it says the game is always running 50-60 which I can assure you it is not. The game generally runs over 60fps unless you enter a lag-prone location. Stability wise I haven't had any issues.

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: None

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: Runs fine with minor stuttering in some areas

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes:
Performance is not great, but considering the GPU, very doable.
I was getting micro-stutters all the time, managed to reduce it by dropping the max fps to 30, and then by ENABLING vsync. (without vsync, game was a stutter insanity), with VSYNC it runs fine.
I get texture flickers and some textures are too dark.
I have a weird input issue with the mouse, where it appears to be limited by the screen edges, so I get stuck at turning a lot. This was more apparent with the HW Cursor setting on, but still an issue with it off.
Massive pauses on first run due to I suppose compiling shaders. It didn't run with MESA 18.1.6

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: 1080p medium settings with AA, ~40-45 fps, Xbox controller works great

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes:

Once crashed while changing graphic preset.

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: Quality turned up to ultra at 1920x1200. Lags right after starting but that disappears after a few minutes of game time. No audio issues, only played until the end of the tutorial so far. Alt-Tab under Gnome 3 leads to unresponsive In-Game-GUI. FPS feel well playable, not measured properly so far.

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
notes: The game experiences micro-stuttering if I don't play with the 60fps cap on and I don't lower my resolution and graphics to a specific amount. For example, 2560x1080 ultra settings or 2560x1440 low settings is fine, but if I play at 2560x1440 or higher on high or ultra settings I get frame stutters every second. I also noticed some rare flickering textures in the distance and as others have said,  a small amount of enemies do not render.

title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt
notes: Voiceovers cut off half a second before the end of each sentence. I'm pretty sure everyone's voices are deeper. I've experienced the same deep voice issues in other games like Life is Strange. The female voices are very deep.

title: Witcher 3
notes: If uses mounted drive for installation needs for advanced mounting options

title: Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt
notes: No issues once the latest drivers were installed

Played game for nearly 2 hours and found performance on par with Windows using resolution 2560x1440, Ultra graphics settings and 60 FPS cap.  I turned off Nvidia Hairworks.  No noticeable glitches or stuttering in sound, graphics or performance during game play even during battles.  Voice over dialog plays completely without interruption.  My distro flavor is Kubuntu.  Extremely excited to play again, fantastic!

title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes: Some very obnoxious audio crackling during cutscenes (both pre-rendered and in-game), but can be fixed with "xaudio2_7" set to native. Aside from that I didn't notice anything wrong (I'm 4 hours in). Performance seems fine given the hardware and it's definitely playable (for reference: about 43fps on "Low" preset walking around in "Nilfgaardian Garrison").
title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes: Seem to run fine so far. Didn't encounter any crashes or bugs

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon R9 200 Series (TONGA, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.5-1-default, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Some Framedrops but not so heavy. No Hair with Nvidia-Hairworks. Played over 1h with 1080p and high settings without other issues.
title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes:
Hairworks on creates a bald Geralt. 

Some elements that I suspect are supposed to have some level of translucency are completely invisible. 

2 monsters encountered (Rotfiends and Wild hunt hounds) that are completely invisible, tricky to fight but with healthbars/names moving around you can still have some idea of were they are and the auto targeting does the rest.

They are not among the most common enemies, at least 59 hours in, an I've only encountered them about 6 times all in all. So not too big a deal, but annoying.

A few times NPC heads in cutscenes also become invisible at times when something changes with the head for one reason or another

What appears to be time dilation can happen if Vsync is off. It's essentially micro stutter, but instead of simply jumping forward a few frames to catch up the game's speed changes. It's a bit trippy.

Performance is good, better than I expected, but I don't know how it compares to Windows.
title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes:
This is an update to my previous report, a downgrade of rating: 

Runs ok, proton updates seem to have degraded frame performance (average 37fps with Vsync at medium quality), still requires the xact fix, and there have been crashes that trace back through proton (in the games own crash logs), but divide into either Exception Access (memory read errors) and Unknown Exceptions, usually during loads of new areas.

title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes: This is my first playthrough of Witcher 3 I've played 11 hours so far 100% everything in White Orchard area. On the older SteamPlay versions the only thing that did not work was Hairworks (Geralt would lose his hair if you enabled it). It is fixed now with SteamPlay Beta 3.16-1 enabled in Steam as well as the DEV 396.54.09 Nvidia drivers that support the new Vulkan extensions. I have also noticed a performance boost with the DEV 396.54.09 Nvidia drivers which allows me to run at 1440P High Settings in the 60-70 FPS range on a GTX 1070. The one thing I will say is sometimes my mouse cursor stats going on my second monitor in Full Screen mode so I changed the setting to Borderless Fullscreen and it works properly now.
title: The Witcher® 3: Wild Hunt

notes: Hairworks  is coming soon. Alt-tabbing and restoring leaves the game to a small square in the top-left corner, clicking on it restores it to normal. Playing on maxed settings @ 1440p, I get 60-65 FPS everywhere.
